info.title: Core API Documentation
info.description:
# Introduction Collection of API related to following app: Calendar - https://calendar.cloudfactory.com
Projects - https://projects.cloudfactory.com
Users - https://users.cloudfactory.com
Searches - https://searches.cloudfactory.com
CRM - https://crm.cloudfactory.com
Channels - https://channels.cloudfactory.com
https://www.related_app.cloudfactory.com - related_app is the placeholder for app name in url for example for calendar, related app name is calendar.cloudfactory.com The following API facilitates these features

tags.name: New Release
tags.description: It comprises of all the changes that are currently being worked on and are in line for release.

tags.name: Pre Release
tags.description: It comprises of all the latest changes that are recently released.

tags.name: Channels
tags.description:
Channel is a tool to streamline communication. The API allows you to
create/update rooms, add/remove members to/from a room, get details of
room/user and update user avatar.

tags.name: Schedules
tags.description:
SCHEDULE REST API


The Schedule REST API allows you to manage the CloudFactory schedules for WorkStream Delivery. You can fetch, create, update and delete schedules along with querying the state of your schedules through the attributes of a scheduled resource.

SCHEDULE RESOURCE


The Schedule resource represents a "shift" - a scope in which a user is scheduled to be available for a specific project on a specific CF delivery hub on a specific time slot of a day.
Schedules also have additional properties that help determine the reporting and billing criterias necessary for the reporting and billing purposes.

Each schedule has these properties -


Name Description
id A 20 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.
user_id The unique id of the User resource associated with this schedule.
project_id The unique id of the Project resource associated with this schedule.
delivery_hub_id The unique id of the Delivery Hub resource associated with this schedule.
slot_id The unique id of the Slot resource associated with this schedule.
status The visibility of this schedule - either published or unpublished.
type The scope of this schedule - either normal or margin.
premium_for_client Determines if a schedule is Premium or Standard for Client User Type - either true or false.
premium_for_worker Determines if a schedule is Premium or Standard for Worker User Type - either true or false.
start_time The date-time that denotes the schedule's start.
end_time The date-time that denotes the schedule's end.
overage Mark a schedule as overage if schedule is created to address overage needs.
break Break time for this schedule.
reported Determines this schedule as reported if a time entry resource exists for this schedule.
custom_attributes Store extra information for this schedule.

tags.name: Time Entries
tags.description:
The TimeEntry REST API allows you to log and manage the workstream work hours put in by a cloud worker. You can start and stop a TimeEntry along with basic fetch, create, update and delete operations. The TimeEntry resource represents a "work duration" - a scope in which a user has worked for a specific workstream on a specific schedule.

Each time_entry has these properties -


Name Description
id A 20 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.
user_id The unique id of the User resource associated with this time_entry.
project_id The unique id of the Project resource associated with this time_entry.
task_id The unique id of the Task resource associated with this time_entry.
slot_id The unique id of the Slot resource associated with this time_entry.
schedule_id The unique id of the Schedule resource associated with this time_entry.
delivery_hub_id The unique id of the Delivery Hub resource associated with this time_entry.
start_time The date-time that denotes the time_entry's start.
end_time The date-time that denotes the time_entry's end.
duration Actual duration worked (in seconds) in this time_entry.
premium_for_client Defines a time_entry as Premium or Standard for Client user type.
premium_for_worker Determines a schedule as Premium or Standard for Workers user type.
notes Provide extra information for this time_entry.
timer Distinguish whether this time_entry is created through the start/stop timer or through Create a time entry API.
overage Distinguish whether this time entry is created to fulfill the overage requirement. Overage value is inherited from Schedule.

post.description: A calendar is a collection of events. But in addition to calendar, they may also have other important meta information or settings that apply to all events in the calendar.

get.description: The Calendar API provides a method to list calendars owned by a resource. Note- The only resource supported right now is "project".

parameters.name: owner_type
parameters.description: The type of owner. The only type supported right now is "project"

parameters.name: owner_id
parameters.description: The identifier to uniquely identify the owner

post.description:
This API allows users to create an event in a specific calendar.
behaviour When a user resource is added to an event. It sends an invitation email to the person. In future, the person might accept or reject the invitation. However, for now, they are considered to have automatically accepted the invitation.

parameters.name: calendar_id
parameters.description: id of calendar

get.description:
Optional query parameters These parameters need to be supplied in query string.
Name Type Description
time_min number Lower bound (inclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. The default is not to filter by end time. ISO 8601 UTC
time_max number Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. The default is not to filter by start time. ISO 8601 UTC
page number The page number for events to be returned. Maximum value depends upon the number of events that gets included and is included in header
per_page number The maximum number of events to be returned per page. Maximum value is 1000 and default value is 100
Notes
  • The results are paginated using standard API pagination mechanism used by CloudFactory platform.
  • The events are ordered by start_date in ascending order.

parameters.name: calendar_id
parameters.description: The id of the calendar in which event was created

get.description: This API allows users to fetch an event through the owner's calendar as well as through the associated resource's  calendar.

parameters.name: calendar_id
parameters.description: The id of the calendar to which event is associated

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of event

put.description:
Editable Parameters
name, description, start_time, end_time, custom_attributes, resources

parameters.name: calendar_id
parameters.description: The id of the calendar in which event was created

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of events

delete.description:
Note
  • When an event is deleted, the event stops being reported from calendars of the associated resources as well.
  • It is possible to delete both past and future events.

parameters.name: calendar_id
parameters.description: The id of the calendar in which event was created

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of events

get.description:
Note
* All four aggregated hours (standard, premium) will be a floating value roundedup to two decimal places. * Summary is calculated as 1. Standard for client => sum of duration when premium_for_client = false 2. Standard for worker => sum of duration when premium_for_worker = false 3. Premium for client => sum of duration when premium_for_client = true 4. Premium for worker => sum of duration when premium_for_worker = true * standard_for_client + premium_for_client = standard_for_worker + premium_for_worker = total time scheduled for that duration * Pagination is added for the list as per our standard pagination rule. Order of the fields in the group by column should not affect the results.
* Group By
  1. Groups the summaries by the given fields. Fields for now- date, type & slot_id
  2. The query parameter group_by must be an array with at least one of date , slot_id and type as the format as shown- group_by[]=date&group_by[]=slot_id&group_by[]=type
      3. Validation
      * Error- group_by has an invalid field * Message- must be an array with at least one of date, slot_id and type * Error Code- 422 Unprocessable Entity * time_min cannot be greater than time_max. It should respond with a 422 error and this message- "time_max must be greater than or equal to time_min"

parameters.name: time_min
parameters.description: time since which the event was started and format according to  ISO 8601 standard

parameters.name: time_max
parameters.description: time before which the event was started and format according to  ISO 8601 standard

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: id of the project for which the event was created

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: status of schedule, can be published or unpublished

parameters.name: slot_id
parameters.description: Id of slot

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: id of the user for whom the event was created

parameters.name: premium_for_client
parameters.description: Denotes whether an event was created for a premium (for client) shift

parameters.name: premium_for_worker
parameters.description: Denotes whether an event was created for a premium (for worker) shift

parameters.name: group_by
parameters.description: Groups the summaries by the given fields. Allows only these three fields for now- date, slot_id & type. Multiple values separated by comma which does the 'AND' operation

put.description:
Description
Currently, when a new parameter is to be added to a Hubspot form, it needs to be changed both in the experience side as well as the core services side. This is quite limiting. So, we want the form submission API to be agnostic to the form content.

get.description:
Description
A milestone is a stage at which a Workstream is in the sales process. It could be just at the first stage of discovery or it could be matured enough to be able to start processing data. Currently, we have a limited set of milestones. So, no need to have a create/delete/update API for milestones. However, we have a way to get and list the milestones.
Currently, we have only these milestones-
Name Order Flow No-Flow
Gathering requirements 1 true true
Preparing a proposal 2 true true
Reviewing service agreement 3 true true
Spinning up team 4 false true
Rapid Prototyping 4 true false
Processing data 5 true true

post.description:
POST /api/v1/projects

Possible Errors
Error Message HTTP status Code
invalid subscription_type can only be one of these 'monthly', 'flex_pass' 422 Unprocessable Entity
invalid billable unit can only be one of these 'hour', 'piece_rate' 422 Unprocessable Entity
invalid workforce_model can only be one of these 'in-house', 'semi-distributed' 422 Unprocessable Entity
invalid payment_option can only be one of these 'yearly', 'monthly', 'one_time' 422 Unprocessable Entity
invalid tools can only be one of these 'client', 'third_party', 'ws_flow' 422 Unprocessable Entity
invalid channel can only be one of these 'api', 'file_upload', 'task_board', 'client_tools' 422 Unprocessable Entity
invalid status can only be one of these 'open', 'closed' 422 Unprocessable Entity
invalid current_milestone does not apply for this project type 422 Unprocessable Entity

parameters.name: subscription_type
parameters.description: monthly | flex_pass

post.description:
Validation
Error Message Code
effective_from is before the project start_date effective_from must be on or after the project start_date 422
effective_from is after effective_till effective_from must be on or before effective_till 422
invalid stage stage must be one of these- validation, proposal, contracting, booked or lost 422

Other Validations
  • monthly_units, monthly_hours, flex_pass_units, flex_pass_hours are positive integers >= 0. monthly_units and flex_pass units could go be in millions but the monthly_hours and flex_pass_hours in general are in thousands
  • monthly_price and flex_pass_price are floating point numbers rounded upto two decimal places. Minimum >=0
  • cannot create a subscription for a "closed" project. If attempted, it will give out this validation error- "can create a subscription only when the project is open" 422.
  • cannot create a subscription if the billable_unit is not present in a project.

Note
  1. The first subscription created under a project will be marked as the base subscription.
  2. For a base subscription, the adjustments values will be an object with all the keys but null in the values.
  3. For others, the adjustments are created based on the current and the previous subscription.
  4. When the subscription_type is flex_pass
    • if the billable_unit is 'hour' - update "flex_pass_hours", "hourly_rate", "flex_pass_price"
    • if billable_unit is 'piece_rate' - update "flex_pass_units", "piece_rate", "flex_pass_price"
  5. When the subscription_type is 'monthly'
    • if billable_unit is 'hour' - update "monthly_hours, hourly_rate, monthly_price"
    • if billable_unit is 'piece_rate' - update "monthly_units, piece_rate, monthly_price"

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: id of project

get.description:
Filter parameters
Filter Description
sf_opportunity_id Optional. Returns the subscription with the given sf_opportunity_id
base Optional. Boolean. List the base subscription
time_min Optional. Lists all the subscriptions that are effective on or after this date.
time_max Optional. Lists all the subscriptions that are effective before this date.
stage Optional. Lists all the subscriptions with the given stage

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Id of project

parameters.name: sf_opportunity_id
parameters.description: Returns the subscription with the given sf_opportunity_id

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: List the base subscription

parameters.name: stage
parameters.description: Lists all the subscriptions with the given stage

parameters.name: time_min
parameters.description: Lists all the subscriptions that are effective on or after this date.

parameters.name: time_max
parameters.description: Lists all the subscriptions that are effective on or before this date.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Id of project

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of subscription

put.description:
Validations
Error Message Code
effective_from is before the project start_date effective_from must be on or after the project start_date 422
effective_from is after effective_till effective_from must be on or before effective_till 422
invalid stage stage must be one of these- validation, proposal, contracting, booked or lost 422
update a subscription that is not the latest one Only the most recent subscription is allowed for update 422

Note
  1. "base" attribute cannot be updated. It is calculated from inside.
  2. For a base subscription, the adjustments values will be an object with all the keys but null in the values.
  3. For others, the adjustments are created based on the current and the previous subscription.
  4. When the subscription_type is flex_pass
    • if the billable_unit is 'hour' - update "flex_pass_hours", "flex_pass_price" , "hourly_rate"
    • if billable_unit is 'piece_rate' - update "flex_pass_units", "flex_pass_price" , "piece_rate"
  5. When the subscription_type is 'monthly'
    • if billable_unit is hour - update "monthly_hours, hourly_rate, monthly_price"
    • if billable_unit is piece_rate - update "monthly_units, piece_rate, monthly_price"

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Id of project

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of subscription

post.description:
App Name: Projects https://projects.cloudfactory.com

POST /api/v1/tasks


This API allows you to create a task.

Possible Errors
Error Message Code
billable is not a boolean must be a boolean 422
task name is either empty or exceeded the max length limit must be a non-blank string with a maximum of 200 characters 422
task name is not unique (compared by ignoring case-sensitivity and leading and trailing spaces) task with the same name already exists 422

Validation
  1. If either the project or the task is not valid, it will return a 404 error with the message- "project | task not found"
  2. If the task is already assigned, it will return 422 Unprocessable entity with the message- "task already assigned to the project"

get.summary: List Tasks assigned to a Project.
get.description: We will have a list of tasks in our platform that can be used by WorkStreams. However, not all tasks are applicable to all WorkStreams. So, we need a mechanism to associate those applicable tasks to each WorkStreams. For that, we have an API to return all the tasks associated with a WorkStream.

post.description:
App Name: Calendar https://calendar.cloudfactory.com

Create Open Shift Request based on the provided parameters

Possible errors
Error Message Code
invalid project_id "project_id" must be a valid project id 422
end_time is in the past "end_time" must be in present or in future 422
end_time is before start_time "end_time" must be greater than or equal to start_time 422
requested_hours is greater than 99999 "requested_hours" must be an integer between 0 and 100K 422

get.description: Lists all the Open Shift Requests based on the provided filter parameters

parameters.name: time_min
parameters.description: Datetime that is before or on the end date of the open shift request

parameters.name: time_max
parameters.description: Datetime that is after the start date of the open shift request

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: A valid project id

parameters.name: overage
parameters.description: A boolean value to denote whether the request is from client or the from internal team

get.description: The API returns a json representation of an Open Shift Request identified by the provided id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of open shift request

put.description:
Note: Supports partial update

Validations
When there are no associated open shifts
Error Message Code
invalid project_id "project_id" must be a valid project id 422
end_time is in the past "end_time" must be in present or in future 422
end_time is before start_time "end_time" must be greater than or equal to start_time 422
requested_hours is greater than 99999 "requested_hours" must be an integer between 0 and 100K 422
When there are associated open shifts
Error Message Code
start_time is passed "start_time" cannot be updated for open shift request having open shifts 422
project_id is passed "project_id" cannot be updated for open shift request having open shifts 422
overage is passed "overage" cannot be updated for open shift request having open shifts 422
end_time is reduced "end_time" cannot be reduced for open shift request having open shifts 422
requested_hours is decreased "requested_hours" cannot be decreased for open shift request having open shifts 422

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of open shift request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of open shift request

post.description:
POST /api/v1/open_shifts

This API allows you to create an open shift for an open shift request.

App Name: Calendar https://calendar.cloudfactory.com

Possible Errors
Error Message Code
schedule_date is in the past schedule_date must be in the future 422
schedule_date not in the range of request schedule_date must be within the range of request 422
created_at is after end_date of open shift request open shift request is already closed 422
claim_deadline is after schedule_date claim_deadline should be on or before the schedule_date 422
max_seats is greater than the total seats in the delivery hub in that particular date and slot max_seats must be between 0 and the total seats in the delivery hub 422

get.description:

This API allows you to fetch an open shift.

put.description:

This API allows you to update the attributes of an open shift.

schedule_date schedule_date cannot be updated for open shifts having claims 422
slot_id slot_id cannot be updated for open shifts having claims 422

post.description:
POST /api/v1/open_shifts/:open_shift_id/claims

This API allows you to create a claim for an open shift.

Possible Errors
Error Message Code
open_shift is closed Cannot claim. Open shift has already been closed 422
deadline of open_shift is missed Cannot claim. Deadline has already passed 422
seat not available in open_shift Cannot claim. All open seats are taken 422
requested hours in open_shift_request already scheduled Cannot claim. Requested hours have already been fulfilled 422
not enough seats available in delivery_hub Cannot claim. Delivery hub doesn't have seats available during the slot 422
user already claimed for the same open shift Cannot claim. User already claimed for the same open shift 422
user already scheduled for that same time period Cannot claim. User already scheduled during the slot 422
user already scheduled for 12 hours on that day Cannot claim. User already scheduled max 12 hours per day 422
user has an approed leave on the open_shift schedule date Cannot claim. User has taken time off on the same slot of the day 422
user not assigned to the project Cannot claim. User not assigned to the project 422

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of open shift

get.description:
GET /api/v1/search/users


This API provides a method to search users by various parameters.
Multiple fields and values
  1. Multiple fields are always AND-ed
  2. Multiple values of a field can be combined using operators explained in following section.
Logical Operators
Name Operator Example Description
AND , available_day=SUN,MON,TUE Available on all three days
OR || available_day=SUN||MON||TUE Available on either of three days
NOT ! available_day=!SUN Not available on Sundays
GREATER THAN > weekly_commitment=>20 weekly commitment is greater than 20
LESS THAN < weekly_commitment=>=20 weekly commitment is less than 20
GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO >= starting_date=>=2016-12-01 Starting date is greater than or equal to december 1st, 2016
LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO <= weekly_commitment=<=6 weekly commitment is less than or equal to 6
LIKE ~ name=~Somnath Name is like Somnath

Searchable fields
These are the list of fields that can be used to search Users
Entity Field Name Sample values Description
Main Attributes name Ram
Ram||Shyam 		Full Name of the User, using like query
country Nepal
Nepal||Kenya 		User’s country of residence
status active
disabled||archived 		The status of the User; that are active, disabled or archived
type Core
Client||Worker 		The type of the User; that are worker, core or client
Membership project_id Dihwd2d8437
ioywefuyqwe,oinuew387 		The ids of the project, which the user is associated with
Worker Attributes starting_date 2016-12-04
<2016-11-01 		The starting/joined date of the worker.
employment_status full time
part time 		The status of a worker, if s/he is full time or part time
weekly_commitment 20
20 || 40 		The number of hours a worker has agreed to work for.
primary_delivery_hub ud243876 The id of the delivery hub that has been set as primary for the worker
Availability available_day SUN
MON||TUE 		The day which the worker is available on
available_time 10:45-12:45
10:45-12:45,12:45-14:45 		The time slots in which the worker is available. The start time and the end time of the slot separated by a dash
Schedule scheduled_time 2016-10-02T10:00:00Z-2016-10-02T14:00:00Z
!2016-10-02T10:00:00Z-2016-10-02T14:00:00Z 		The time range in which the worker has been scheduled to work on any project
*New-Release

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search users having name similar to. eg- Ram Sharan

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Search users having user type client, worker and core.
eg- worker
eg- worker||client

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Search users based on their status active, disabled or archived .
eg- active
eg- disabled||archived

parameters.name: country
parameters.description:
Search users residing on some specific countries.
eg- US
eg- Nepal||Kenya

parameters.name: starting_date
parameters.description:
Search users who started working from a specific date. Primarily applicable for users with type worker.
eg- 2016-12-04
eg- <2016-11-01
eg- 2017-01-04||>=2017-01-09

parameters.name: available_day
parameters.description:
Search users based on their preferred days of availability in a week. Primarily applicable for users with type worker.
eg- SUN
eg- MON,TUE

parameters.name: available_time
parameters.description:
Search users based on their preferred time of availability. Primarily applicable for users with type worker.
eg- 10:45-12:45
eg- 10:45-12:45,12:45-14:45

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description:
Search users associated with some specific projects.
eg- bydnSFrBeQyAQx6bwSYR
eg- bydnSFrBeQyAQx6bwSYR||qYytSYyYqiFSoYOFdMuM

parameters.name: weekly_commitment
parameters.description:
Search users on basis of the hours commited to work. Primarily applicable for users with type worker.
eg- !20
eg- 20||40

parameters.name: employement_status
parameters.description:
Search users on basis of full time or part time employment. Primarily applicable for users with type worker.
eg- part_time

parameters.name: primary_delivery_hub
parameters.description:
Search users on basis of some specific delivery hub id. Primarily applicable for users with type worker.
eg- VzKu93fIa45VZJpKhiq2

parameters.name: scheduled_time
parameters.description:
Search users on basis of the time they have been scheduled for work. Primarily applicable for users with type worker.
eg- 2016-10-02T10:00:00Z-2016-10-02T14:00:00Z
eg- !2016-10-02T10:00:00Z-2016-10-02T14:00:00Z

put.description:
Description
The Core Services provides a way to save worker's availability.
Motivation
In the UI, the workers report their availability by themselves.
Notes
1. Since all fields inside slots are required, not providing them would generate validation error. We are following our standard validation error format. 2. The core services tracks available slots instead of unavailable slots. The UI might require the users to put in unavailable slots but the UI will translate it to available slots when calling the API. 3. No need to support preferred slots and exceptions for the first version. There is no validation for overlapping slots. However, system internally stores availability information correctly. 4. The availability is an integral part of worker sign-up process. Therefore, it is unlikely that it would not be filled out. However, if it is indeed not filled out, it should be assumed that the worker is not available in a given slot. In other words, if a worker hasn't explicitly mentioned that he or she is available in any given time slot, he or she should be considered unavailable.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: id of users

get.description:
App Name: Usershttps://users.cloudfactory.com

GET /api/v1/delivery_hubs

This API allows you to fetch all the delivery_hubs that are available for worker scheduling.

GET /api/v1/delivery_hubs/:id

This API allows you to fetch the details of a specific delivery_hub resource.

GET /api/v1/delivery_hubs/:id/capacity

This API allows you to get the capacity of a specific delivery_hub capacity based some query parameters

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the delivery_hub resource

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: query delivery_hub capacity for this specific date

parameters.name: slot_id
parameters.description: query delivery_hub capacity for this specific slot

get.description:
The workers work in shifts (or slots) in a delivery hub. The current understanding is that all delivery hubs will use standard slots. The slots are specified in GMT in the following section.
  1. 9:00 PM - 1:00 AM
  2. 1:00 AM - 5:00 AM
  3. 5:00 AM - 9:00 AM
  4. 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM
  5. 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM
  6. 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM
Whether or not a particularity slot is available in a delivery hub depends on the delivery hub. For example, 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM may not be available in CF HQ.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of slot

put.description:
PUT /api/v1/time_entries/:id

This API allows you to update the properties of a specific time entry resource.
[Pre Release] New custom attribute added in the request body and response.
[Pre Release] New validations for a running time entry.

Validations

Error Message Code
user does not exist must be a valid user id 422
slot does not exist must be a valid slot id 422
schedule does not exist must be a valid schedule id 422
delivery hub does not exist must be a valid delivery hub id 422
end_time is less than start_time end_time must be greater than or equal to start_time 422

[Pre Release] Validations for running time entry

Error Message Code
duration is passed in the request parameter for running time entry cannot update running time entry 422
end_time is passed in the request parameter for running time entry cannot update running time entry 422

get.description:
GET /api/v1/time_entries/:id

This API allows you to fetch a specific time entry resource. [Pre Release] New custom attribute added in the response.

delete.description:
DELETE /api/v1/time_entries/:id

This API allows you to delete a specific time_entry resource.

post.description:
POST /api/v1/users/:user_id/time_entries/start

This API allows you to track the time spent on delivering the requested hours of work in a WorkStream. You can start a timer by providing the minimum data needed for a time_entry resource to be created. [Pre Release] New custom attribute added in the response.

get.description:
GET /api/v1/users/:user_id/time_entries/current

This API allows you to fetch the currently running time_entry for a specific user. [Pre Release] New custom attribute added in the response.

put.description:
PUT /api/v1/users/:user_id/time_entries/stop

This API allows you to stop a running time_entry for a specific user. [Pre Release] New custom attribute added in the response.

get.description:
GET /api/v1/time_entries/stats/total_hours

This API provides aggregated data for the selected time_entries by categorizing them into four sections namely -
1. Standard for client => sum of duration when premium_for_client = false
2. Standard for worker => sum of duration when premium_for_worker = false
3. Premium for client => sum of duration when premium_for_client = true
4. Premium for worker => sum of duration when premium_for_worker = true
5. Client.base => The sum of hours reported that are not marked as overage (overage is false).
6. Client.overage (client) => The sum of hours reported that are marked as overage (overage is true).
7. Worker.base => The sum of hours reported by worker by working on the regular shifts (based on the employment status with CF).
8. Worker.overage (worker) => The sum of hours reported by worker by working on the extra shifts.

post.description:
POST /api/v1/time_offs

This method allows users to create time off requests.

Possible Errors

Field Message Code
Incorrect or missing leave_type must be "regular", "sick" or "emergency" 422
Incorrect or missing status must be "pending", "approved" or "denied" 422
Time off spans over two years time offs can not span two years 422

GET /api/v1/users/:user_id/time_offs/stats

This API provides the information about time_offs which includes:
  1. how much time off a user has taken
  2. how much balance is remaining
  3. how much balance is carried forward from the previous year

Note
Partial update is not available on the following attributes -
address, client_attributes, worker_attributes, custom_attributes
All the sub-attributes needs to be sent with old values even when the sub-attribute is not intended for update.
If something is to be deleted, the value needs to be sent as null.
Validations
Error Message HTTP status Code
invalid status must be one of active, disabled or archived 422 Unprocessable Entity

get.description: There could be several use cases where a user needs to be searched via email instead of just id. One of them is- when a user is being added to a project via email, it needs to be first verified whether that person already exists or not. And, to do that, we need to search the user via email.

ProjectsStartDate.description: Start date of the project according to ISO 8601 standard.

ProjectsSubscriptionType.description: One of "monthly" or "flex_pass" subscriptions the client has subscribed to.

ProjectsBillableUnit.description: One of "hour" or "piece_Rate" unit defining how client will be charged.

ProjectsWorkforceModel.description: One of "in-house" or "semi-distributed" workforce model selected for the project.

ProjectsWSFlowEnabled.description: Determines whether the project uses workstream flow.

ProjectsWSShieldEnabled.description: Determines whether the project uses workstream shield.

ProjectsPaymentOption.description: One of "yearly", "monthly" or "one_time" payment option selected for the project.

ProjectsTools.description: One of "client", "third_party" or "ws_flow" tools selected for processing the project tasks.

ProjectsChannel.description: One of "api", "file_upload", "task_board" or "client_tools" selected for receiving the project tasks.

ProjectsStatus.description: One of "open" or "closed" status for a project.

ProjectsEstimatedTimePerUnit.description: Estimated number of seconds per unit. Applicable only for WorkStream Flow.

ProjectsCurrentMilestone.description: Milestone ID of the base subscription of the project.
